npcs.name: Tom the Farmer
npcs.description: A humble farmer looking for simple ale and a warm meal

npcs.name: Bob the Merchant
npcs.description: A traveling merchant with exotic goods and business opportunities

cards.title: Thirsty Farmer
cards.situation: Tom enters your tavern, exhausted from a long day in the fields. His clothes are dusty and he looks parched. He approaches the bar with a weary smile.

options.resultText: Tom's face lights up as he tastes the cold ale. 'Just what I needed!' he exclaims, telling other farmers about your hospitality.

options.text: Serve watered-down ale to save costs
options.resultText: Tom frowns after the first sip. 'This tastes like dishwater,' he mutters, leaving quickly.

options.text: Offer premium imported ale for more gold
options.resultText: Tom is surprised but pleased. 'Fancy stuff! Worth every copper!' He'll definitely be back.

options.text: Apologize and say you're out of ale
options.resultText: Tom sighs deeply. 'What kind of tavern runs out of ale?' He leaves disappointed.

cards.title: Merchant's Offer
cards.description: A merchant has a special business proposition
cards.situation: Bob enters with a confident smile. 'I have a deal that could benefit us both! I need a reliable supplier for my caravan routes.'

options.resultText: Bob shakes your hand firmly. 'Excellent! This partnership will make us both wealthy!' Your tavern will supply his caravans.
After some haggling, Bob agrees to your terms. 'You drive a hard bargain, but fair enough!' The deal is struck.
Bob nods understandingly. 'Perhaps another time. I respect your caution.' He leaves on good terms.

options.text: Rudely refuse and insult his goods
options.resultText: Bob's face reddens with anger. 'You'll regret this insult!' He storms out, vowing never to return.
